Teofilo Henson (President and CEO)| launch_date = 1970 (radio broadcasts)
1992 (television broadcasts)| owner = | founder = | past_names = World TV 21 (1992-1996)| website = [http://www.talktv.ph www.talktv.ph]| }} '''SBN (Southern Broadcasting Network, Inc.)''' is a Philippine [[television network]] owned by Filipino-Chinese tycoon [[Lucio Co]], the owner of [[List of shopping malls in the Philippines#Puregold Price Club Inc.|Puregold Price Club Inc.]], a supermarket chain. Its main broadcast facilities at 5/F Summit One Bldg, Shaw Boulevard, Mandaluyong City. It's TV station ([[DWCP-TV|DWCP-TV 21]]) became the first local [[UHF]] TV station in Metro Manila in May, 1992. ==History== Southern Broadcasting Network of [[Davao]] launched SBN Channel 21, the first local UHF TV station in [[Metro Manila]] starting 1992. It was then known as World TV 21. The idea is to bring back programming similar to the forcibly shut-down [[Far East Network|FEN]] Channel 17 of the former Clark US Air Base a year earlier due to the eruption of Mt. Pinatubo. Beginning on January 1, 2008, [[Solar Entertainment Corporation|Solar Entertainment]] began to lease airtime on SBN, choosing to broadcast programming from its entertainment channel [[ETC (TV channel)|ETC]].[http://www.etc.com.ph/news.htm ETC Available on SBN 21] This partnership ended in March 2, 2011, as Solar transferred ETC to [[Radio Philippines Network|RPN]]. As a result, SBN now carries the news network [[Talk TV (Philippines)|Talk TV]], headed by Jing Magsaysay, former [[ABS-CBN Corporation]]/[[ABS-CBN News Channel|ANC]] news anchor and President [[Benigno Aquino III]]'s inaugural spokesperson.[http://www.manilastandardtoday.com/insideBusop.htm?f=2011/february/25/vicagustin.isx&d=2011/february/25 Tiengs move into news] Manila Standard Today. 02-25-2011. Retrieved 02-25-2011. ==Talk TV programs== {{main|List of programs broadcast by Talk TV}} ==SBN Slogans== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Branding ! Slogan !
